data.plant_info: Aloe Vera is a succulent plant species of the genus Aloe. It is widely known for its medicinal and cosmetic uses, particularly its soothing gel that can be applied to burns and skin irritations.
data.plant_care: Aloe Vera prefers bright, indirect sunlight and should be watered sparingly, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings. It thrives in well-draining soil and can tolerate drought conditions.
data.plant_fertilizer: use a balanced fertilizer during the growing season

data.plant_info: Cacti are succulent plants that are adapted to survive in arid environments. They store water in their stems and have spines instead of leaves to reduce water loss.
data.plant_care: Cacti require plenty of sunlight and should be watered infrequently, allowing the soil to dry out completely between waterings. They thrive in sandy, well-draining soil.
data.plant_fertilizer: use a cactus-specific fertilizer during the growing season

data.plant_info: Orchids are a diverse and widespread family of flowering plants, known for their unique and intricate flowers. They can be found in a variety of habitats, from tropical rainforests to arid deserts.
data.plant_care: Orchids prefer bright, indirect light and should be watered when the potting medium is dry to the touch. They thrive in well-draining orchid mix and benefit from regular fertilization during the growing season.
data.plant_fertilizer: use a balanced orchid fertilizer every 2-4 weeks during the growing season

data.plant_info: Snake Plant, also known as Mother-in-Law's Tongue, is a hardy indoor plant known for its striking upright leaves. It is an excellent air purifier and can tolerate low light conditions.
data.plant_care: Snake Plants prefer indirect light but can tolerate low light. They should be watered sparingly, allowing the soil to dry out completely between waterings. They thrive in well-draining soil.
data.plant_fertilizer: use a balanced fertilizer during the growing season

data.plant_info: Lavender is a fragrant herb known for its beautiful purple flowers and calming scent. It is often used in aromatherapy and as a culinary herb.
data.plant_care: Lavender prefers full sun and well-draining soil. It should be watered sparingly, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings. Pruning after flowering helps maintain its shape.
data.plant_fertilizer: use a low-nitrogen fertilizer during the growing season

data.plant_info: Peace Lily is a popular indoor plant known for its elegant white flowers and glossy green leaves. It is also known for its air-purifying qualities.
data.plant_care: Peace Lilies prefer low to medium indirect light and should be watered when the top inch of soil feels dry. They thrive in well-draining potting mix and benefit from occasional misting.
data.plant_fertilizer: use a balanced fertilizer every 6-8 weeks during the growing season

data.plant_info: Roses are one of the most popular flowering plants, known for their beautiful blooms and sweet fragrance. They come in a variety of colors and sizes.
data.plant_care: Roses prefer full sun and well-draining soil. They should be watered deeply but infrequently, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings. Regular pruning helps promote healthy growth.
data.plant_fertilizer: use a rose-specific fertilizer during the growing season

data.plant_info: Spider Plant is a hardy indoor plant known for its arching green leaves and small white flowers. It is easy to care for and can thrive in a variety of conditions.
data.plant_care: Spider Plants prefer bright, indirect light but can tolerate low light. They should be watered when the top inch of soil feels dry. They thrive in well-draining potting mix and benefit from occasional misting.
data.plant_fertilizer: use a balanced fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during the growing season

data.plant_info: Bamboo Palm is a popular indoor plant known for its feathery fronds and air-purifying qualities. It adds a tropical touch to any indoor space.
data.plant_care: Bamboo Palms prefer bright, indirect light and should be watered when the top inch of soil feels dry. They thrive in well-draining potting mix and benefit from occasional misting.
data.plant_fertilizer: use a balanced fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during the growing season

data.plant_info: Fiddle Leaf Fig is a popular indoor plant known for its large, glossy leaves that resemble fiddle instruments. It is a striking addition to any indoor space.
data.plant_care: Fiddle Leaf Figs prefer bright, indirect light and should be watered when the top inch of soil feels dry. They thrive in well-draining potting mix and benefit from occasional misting.
data.plant_fertilizer: use a balanced fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during the growing season

data.plant_info: Mint is a fragrant herb known for its refreshing aroma and flavor. It is commonly used in culinary dishes, teas, and cocktails.
data.plant_care: Mint prefers full sun to partial shade and well-draining soil. It should be watered regularly, keeping the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged. Pruning helps promote bushy growth.
data.plant_fertilizer: use a balanced fertilizer during the growing season

data.plant_info: Pothos is a hardy indoor plant known for its trailing vines and heart-shaped leaves. It is easy to care for and can thrive in a variety of conditions.
data.plant_care: Pothos prefer bright, indirect light but can tolerate low light. They should be watered when the top inch of soil feels dry. They thrive in well-draining potting mix and benefit from occasional misting.
data.plant_fertilizer: use a balanced fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during the growing season
